title: Tesla vs. robotaxis: Who’s winning the autonomous vehicle race?
content:
We’re on the edge of a major social shift in mobility. Autonomous vehicles are going to change our lives. Commutes will be unrecognizable, cities will change, and industries reshaped.  We’re still a long way away from that — but companies are edging ever closer. There are prime examples, both approaching the challenge in very different ways. The first is Tesla, with its beta-testing of Level 2 driver-assist tech that aims to progress to full vehicle automation. The second is a group of companies involved in the development and deployment of autonomous robotaxis. But how do they compare? And how do we get…

This story continues at The Next Web

Or just read more coverage about: Tesla
description: We currently see robotaxis deployed in several cities. Can Tesla catch up with their dream of vehicle automation?
